main event: An object resembling a shooting star was reported over Hopetown, South Africa on June 25, 1960.
interesting points: The object was observed twice, with a smoke trail seen approximately 5000 ft,The object had a brilliant white color, resembling burning magnesium,The observed motion of the object was slower than a shooting star,The sighting lasted for 15-20 minutes,The local military source suggested the object could be a balloon, aircraft, or meteor but was classified as probable astronomical.
sighted object: an object resembling a shooting star
